page.title: 18Biggen Farm, Fordham.
page.content: { Biggen Farm}is a listed building. The house was built in 1750 or 1850. It has a timber frame. Part of it is gault brick and clunch with a red brick stack. There is a thatched hipped roof to the original building with slated outshuts. The windows are casement windows in centred arches with shutters. They have a boarded oak door. There is a main part with two identical wings added on.Inside there are ten rooms downstairs and eight rooms upstairs including a maid's bedroom and bathroom ,two studies a cellar, an attic and a library.There are three staircases one of which is very narrow with old banisters. In the garden there is a summer house that turns round like a roundabout to catch the sun. Remains from a Roman Villa have been found in the garden.
